title: Giant Gap Persists Between Job Openings and Available Workers
summary: Total openings stayed near record levels in October as people quit positions at a strong pace. U.S. job openings continue to far outpace the number of available workers, with nearly five million more open positions than people seeking work.

title: Instagram, Other Social-Media Apps Need Stricter Regulation, Senators Say
summary: 'Time for self-policing is over,' Sen. Richard Blumenthal tells Instagram head Adam Mosseri, citing risks to youth. WASHINGTON-Instagram's top executive clashed Wednesday with senators over the photo-sharing app's impact on young users, during a contentious hearing where lawmakers in both parties argued for stricter government oversight of social-media apps.

title: FDA Authorizes AstraZeneca Covid-19 Antibody as Novel Tool to Prevent Symptomatic Disease
summary: Drug combination called Evusheld aimed at minority for whom vaccines are less effective. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration authorized a preventive antibody combination from AstraZeneca PLC that has shown strong efficacy in reducing risk of symptomatic Covid-19, offering a first-of-its-kind alternative for a minority of people for whom vaccines are considered less effective.

title: Roku Shares Rise on Deal That Restores YouTube TV App
summary: Streaming-device maker had removed YouTube TV app from its channel store in April. Shares in Roku Inc. jumped as high as 20% Wednesday after the streaming-device maker signed a multiyear agreement with Alphabet Inc. that restores the YouTube TV app to its service.

title: The Theranos Trial: What to Know After Elizabeth Holmes's Lawyers Rest Their Case
summary: The startup founder is undergoing a lengthy trial over allegations of defrauding investors and patients. Elizabeth Holmes dropped out of Stanford University at 19 years old to start the company that became Theranos, a startup that promised to revolutionize the blood-testing industry. After operating largely in secret for a decade, Theranos began in 2013 publicizing its technology, which it said could test for more than 200 health conditions with a few drops of blood extracted from a finger prick, eliminating the need for large needles and vials of blood. The company's valuation eventually reached more than $9 billion.

title: 'Deliberate Evil' Review: In the Dark Salem Night
summary: The killing of a wealthy former slaver in 19th-century Salem brought famous names and lurid details to the ensuing murder trial.. The trials most often associated with Salem, Mass., took place in colonial America and resulted in the hangings of 19 women and men convicted of witchcraft. Almost 150 years later, Salem was again gripped by prosecutions and executions, but while the 17th-century witch trials remain infamous today, the events of 1830, which consumed the region at the time, have been largely forgotten.

title: Pfizer Says Booster Neutralized Omicron but Variant May Elude Two Doses
summary: Two vaccine doses were significantly less effective against variant but could still protect against severe disease, Pfizer and BioNTech say. Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE said that a third dose of their Covid-19 vaccine neutralized the Omicron variant in lab tests but that the two-dose regimen was significantly less effective at blocking the virus.

title: GameStop Earnings Report: Loss Widened Last Quarter
summary: Retailer posts sales growth amid turnaround efforts. GameStop Corp. widened its loss and posted revenue growth last quarter as it continued efforts to revitalize its business under a recently overhauled executive team and board of directors.

title: SoundCloud to Expand Free Services to Attract New Artists
summary: The music-streaming company expects to generate a net profit by 2023, its CFO said. SoundCloud Ltd., the music-streaming platform known for launching the careers of Billie Eilish, Post Malone and other artists, plans to offer additional services for free to attract more musicians to its platform, the company's chief financial officer said.

title: Stupid Inflation Tricks, Round 2
summary: An energy executive instructs Sen. Warren on natural gas prices and CO2 emissions.. Progressives want Americans to believe that inflation always and everywhere is the result of corporate greed rather than their policies. Behold how they are trying to blame rising energy prices on U.S. oil and gas producers.

title: GameStop's Stock Price Holds Steady-For Meme Stock
summary: The original meme stock has hovered close to $200 a share, defying expectations that gains would be short-lived. GameStop Corp. has been less volatile lately.

title: Biden Rules Out Unilateral Force if Russia Invades Ukraine
summary: Day after video talk with U.S. president, Russia's leader Putin doesn't rule out invasion. President Biden said Wednesday he hoped to convene meetings between Russia and NATO allies to discuss Moscow's troop buildup along the Ukrainian border, and ruled out the unilateral use of U.S. force if Russia invades its neighbor.

title: The Best TV of 2021: Choose Your Own Adventure
summary: The television landscape is broader-and more inviting-than ever before thanks to shows like 'Ted Lasso,' Stanley Tucci's 'Searching for Italy' and Peter Jackson's epic documentary on the Beatles.. Some of the more memorable new shows of 2021 weren't really new-the footage Peter Jackson used in "The Beatles: Get Back," for instance, was more than 50 years old. But the second season of "Never Have I Ever" and the third season of "Sex Education" were also among the best things on television this past year. They provided evidence that series could actually improve with age. They raised viewer hopes for 2022. Maybe Stanley Tucci will even go back to Italy?

title: 'Bill Anderson: As Far As I Can See' Review: A Wearer of Many (Cowboy) Hats
summary: The legendary songwriter-and Grand Ole Opry cast member, soap-opera actor, game-show presenter and more-is the focus of an exhibition at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum..

title: U.S. Stocks Close Higher
summary: Investors assess Omicron, economic data; oil prices waver. U.S. stocks finished modestly higher Wednesday as investors maintained confidence in markets despite the emergence of the Omicron variant and mixed economic data.

title: 'Milton Avery' Review: A Luminary Outside the Mainstream
summary: The painter's first retrospective since 1982 reveals the genius in his formal economy and use of color..

title: Their Friends the Americans
summary: The Saudis are running out of ammo to defend against the Houthis.. Bernard Lewis, the late, great scholar of the Middle East, once quipped to us that while it is dangerous to be America's enemy, it can be fatal to be its friend. We wonder if that's how the Saudis feel as they plead for America for help as it runs out of ammunition to defend against the Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen.

title: About All Those Pandemic Billionaires
summary: Thomas Piketty shows how government stoked wealth inequality.. Christmas came early this year for economic progressives with the publication Tuesday of a fat report on global inequality. It's the product of a Parisian think tank founded by economist Thomas Piketty, and despite praise from the usual suspects it's a turkey.

title: Photos Emerge at Trial of Maxwell With Epstein
summary: Photos entered into evidence at Maxwell's sex-trafficking trial include a foot rub on a private jet. A trove of photographs of British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein give a glimpse of their jet-setting lives together.

title: Capitalism-the People's Choice
summary: Gallup finds that most Americans prefer capitalism.. Politicians and think tanks these days welcome the death of free markets as they support more power for the state. But a new poll from Gallup confirms that the American people still have more faith in capitalism than they do in socialism. Gallup further reports that this support for capitalism over socialism has held steady for more than a decade.

title: Allergan Reaches $200 Million Opioid Settlement With New York Authorities
summary: Deal came just ahead of closing arguments in a long-running trial alleging drugmaker, others allowed opioids to flood region. Pharmaceutical maker AbbVie Inc.'s Allergan unit has agreed to pay up to $200 million to New York state and two New York counties to settle claims that it helped create a public nuisance by allowing opioids to flood the region, according to the company and the office of state Attorney General Letitia James.

title: Those Who Campaign, Teach My Students
summary: In a semester at UT Austin, I tried to show how to hook voters and rise in politics.. Austin, Texas

title: Federal Courts Aren't Royal Ones
summary: The judiciary should make it harder for judges to influence the selection of their successors.. Under the U.S. Constitution, federal judges are picked by the president with the advice and consent of the Senate. Judges don't pick their own successors. But some judges might need a refresher on this provision of the Constitution.

title: Yes, the Crime Wave is as Bad as You Think
summary: Progressives gaslight the public by claiming things used to be worse.. The U.S. experienced its largest-ever single year homicide spike in 2020, and crime now polls as one of the top voter concerns. This has many criminal-justice-reform advocates and their media allies scrambling to convince Americans that things aren't really so bad, no matter what the data say.

title: Hong Kong Listing Means More Trouble for Didi
summary: 'National security' laws allow Beijing to operate with impunity, free from foreign regulatory scrutiny.. The announcement that Didi Chuxing , China's leading ride-hailing company, intends to delist its shares from the New York Stock Exchange sent shock waves through the global financial markets and investment community. Didi's plan is to relist on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, allowing investors who bought shares on the NYSE to swap them for shares if and when there is a Hong Kong listing.

title: Defense Rests Its Case in Trial of Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes
summary: Theranos founder, who faces 11 counts of wire fraud and conspiracy, testified over seven days. SAN JOSE, Calif.-Elizabeth Holmes's lawyers rested their case Wednesday in her criminal-fraud trial, after the founder of blood-testing startup Theranos Inc. gave testimony over seven days in which she acknowledged regrets but also placed blame on her former deputy and boyfriend.

title: Biden to Nominate Meg Whitman to Be U.S. Ambassador to Kenya
summary: Tech veteran was Republican nominee for California governor in 2010. WASHINGTON-President Biden intends to nominate tech-industry leader Meg Whitman, a Republican, to be U.S. ambassador to Kenya, the White House said Wednesday.

title: If the Supreme Court Overturns Roe v. Wade
summary: Yes, the end of Roe would disrupt U.S. politics and the idea that no liberal policy can ever change.. Historians of our era will forever try to pinpoint the event that caused Americans to reduce their politics to a constant lunge at one another's throats. Always in the running for that catastrophe is the Supreme Court's Roe v. Wade decision establishing a constitutional right to abortion. This country's politics will stay polarized until the broad consequences of the Roe decision are resolved.

title: How I Reached the Tipping Point
summary: Another customer gave a Whole Foods cashier a hard time. I gave her a $20 bill.. New York

title: This Inflation Defies the Old Models
summary: Neither supply or demand by itself is increasing prices; it's an unusual combination of both. Last April, economists thought inflation would be around 2.5% right now. Instead, it's over 6%. Even by the forgiving standards of economic forecasting, that's a miss of epic proportions.

title: Biden Commits U.S. Government to Net-Zero Emissions by 2050
summary: Executive order directs federal agencies to make all of their vehicle purchases zero-emission units by 2035. WASHINGTON-President Biden on Wednesday committed the federal government to net-zero emissions by 2050, including directing federal agencies to make all of their vehicle purchases zero-emission units by 2035.

title: Who Read What: Political Figures Share Their Favorite Books of 2021
summary: Henry Cuellar, Kyrsten Sinema, Maggie Hassan and others weigh in on the reading that inspired them this year..

summary: Selections from Indra Nooyi, David M. Rubenstein, Robert Iger and others..

title: Who Read What: Entertainers Share Their Favorite Books of 2021
summary: Picks from Keyshawn Johnson, Hayley Mills, Nick Offerman and others..

title: Who Read What: Writers Share Their Favorite Books of 2021
summary: Selections from Brad Meltzer, Diane Johnson, Roosevelt Montás and others..

title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments on State Funds for Religious Schools
summary: Case challenges Maine's exclusion of religious schools from voucher program covering rural areas without public schools. WASHINGTON-Conservative justices Wednesday appeared skeptical of Maine's secondary education system for rural areas that lack public schools, because the state provides parents tuition vouchers for private schools with nonsectarian curricula but excludes those that teach subjects through a religious lens.

title: Undercover (Thursday Crossword, December 9)
U.K. Imposes New Restrictions as Omicron Cases Double Every Few Days
summary: British authorities say the variant could result in over a million total infections by the end of the month. LONDON-The British government warned that Covid-19 infections caused by the Omicron variant are doubling every two or three days, as it imposed new restrictions in England, including a work from home order and a requirement for proof of vaccination for indoor venues such as nightclubs.

title: Jussie Smollett Trial: The Latest on What to Know About the 'Empire' Actor
summary: Jury begins deliberations after closing arguments. Actor Jussie Smollett is standing trial in Chicago for allegedly faking a hate crime in late January 2019, after telling police and the media that two men had hit him, hung a noose around his neck and yelled a pro-Donald Trump slogan along with racist and antigay slurs.

title: California May Pay Expenses for Women Seeking Abortions From Other States
summary: Democratic leaders want to make California a 'sanctuary' if Roe v Wade is overturned or curtailed. California political leaders are looking for ways to provide financial and logistical support to women who come to the state seeking abortions if Roe v. Wade is overturned or severely curtailed, including possibly paying for gas, lodging, and child care, as well as compensating providers for services rendered to low-income patients.

title: Judge Sets Hearing Over New York City Covid-19 Vaccine Mandate for Public Workers
summary: Hearing comes shortly after Mayor Bill de Blasio announced new requirement for private-sector workers. A New York state judge set a hearing for next week over New York City's Covid-19 vaccine mandate for municipal workers.

title: Smollett Trial Attorneys Deliver Closing Arguments
summary: Case has focused on dueling testimonies between former 'Empire' actor and two brothers he allegedly paid to attack him. CHICAGO-Lawyers presented their closing arguments in Jussie Smollett's criminal trial Wednesday and the jury began deliberations in a case that has largely hinged on contradictory testimony from the former "Empire" actor and the two men who said he paid them to fake a hate crime against him.

title: Children and the Burden of Covid Policy
summary: A mandate deadline approaches at one of America's largest school systems.. Since the start of the pandemic, some media folk have continued to insist on making obscene comparisons between the number of Americans who have died with Covid and the number of Americans killed in various wars, as if it's irrelevant whether one dies at age 80 or age 18. But there is one way in which Covid really is similar to combat. In both cases, aging policy makers demand disproportionate sacrifices from the young.

title: Apple Wins Delay in Monopoly Case, Allowing App Store Rules to Stay for Now
summary: Ruling puts off enforcement in case between iPhone maker, Epic Games until appeal can be heard. Apple Inc. on Wednesday won a U.S. appeals court reprieve in rolling out changes to the App Store ordered by a federal judge as part of the big tech company's antitrust battle with Epic Games Inc.

title: Justice Department Told Deutsche Bank Lender May Have Violated Criminal Settlement
summary: The possible violation is related to an internal complaint in its asset-management arm's sustainable investing business. The Justice Department has informed Deutsche Bank AG that the German lender may have violated a criminal settlement when it failed to tell prosecutors about an internal complaint in its asset-management arm's sustainable investing business, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: What to Watch: Movies, Shows and Stories to Stream
summary: Resume Subscription. Sandra Bullock is fresh out of prison and searching for the sister she raised in "The Unforgivable." Also streaming this week: "And Just Like That...," featuring (most of) the ladies from "Sex and the City" back for a new season under a new name; Olivia Colman and David Thewlis buried their secrets in "Landscapers"; and "Hemingway's Picasso" looks at a mystery sparked by a notorious 1980s Miami drug-runner. Here's where to find it all:

title: Female Founders in Short Supply at Enterprise Tech Startups
summary: Less than 2% of enterprise software startups in the U.S. feature a female founder, a new report finds. Less than 2% of enterprise software startups in the U.S. have at least one female founder according to a new report.

title: A Miami Couple Joins a Rush of Luxury Buyers to the Area's Venetian Islands
summary: They now own homes on Di Lido and San Marino, recently purchasing their forever home for $8.9 million and launching a $2 million renovation. Miami Beach has been on a wild ride these past two decades. Dina Goldentayer has been right there along with it.

title: Blind to the Flaws of Build Back Better
summary: Alan Blinder overstates the plan's benefits and skirts past its true cost.. Alan Blinder's advice in "Look at Build Back Better's Benefits, Not Its Price Tag" (op-ed, Dec. 6) is precisely the kind that has put the country on a path to budget ruin. His counsel is offered while the public debt-to-GDP ratio is already higher than it was immediately after World War II. The Congressional Budget Office estimates that the public debt is on a path to approach 200% of GDP by 2050.

title: Judicial Deference, Liberty and the Common Law
summary: The answer to poor judging is better judging, not deference to the political branches.. In treating the advent of judicial review as a "radical development," Judge Raymond Kethledge's review of Randy Barnett and Evan Bernick's "The Original Meaning of the 14th Amendment" (Bookshelf, Nov. 30) gets off on the wrong foot by privileging the right of self-government over that of individual liberty. The power of judges to overrule democratic decisions was at least implicit in the Declaration of Independence, where liberty comes first and self-government second, as a means toward liberty, but only as constrained by our written Constitution as interpreted by our courts. To hold otherwise is to render the majority a judge in its own case and strip the Constitution of its power to discipline we the people.

title: You Won't Beat the Market, but Don't Let It Drown You
summary: The best advisers will help you build an ark before retirement.. As he approaches retirement, Russell Wild is justifiably concerned (Letters, Dec. 1) that James Glassman is once again being overly optimistic ("Get Ready for Dow One Million," op-ed, Nov. 3). Rest assured, Mr. Wild, that in 38 years of helping people become responsible stewards of the financial assets to which they have been temporarily entrusted, I have never known anyone who could successfully predict the market, at least in the short term.

title: A No-Win Situation at the Amazon Union Vote
summary: The NRLB had the company boxed in.. The National Labor Relations Board ruled that Amazon's union vote was unfair in part because a U.S. Postal Service receptacle was installed in a spot where employees could potentially be monitored ("A Dubious Union Revote at Amazon," Review & Outlook, Dec. 1). The irony is that, had there already been a Postal Service box in a monitored area, and Amazon decided to deter its use for fear that employees might feel pressured in some way, then the same NLRB would have claimed that the election was unfree and unfair-because Amazon made it harder for employees to vote.

title: Bob Dole and the Case Against Term Limits
summary: America would have lost several decades of the contributions of this remarkable and brave man.. If term limits were law, and Bob Dole had been shuttled back to Russell, Kan., after his first few forays in Congress, America would have lost several decades of the contributions of this remarkable and brave man ("Robert Joseph Dole," Review & Outlook, Dec. 6). A better way of cleaning house than term limits is found at the ballot box. Vote for those of quality and vote against those unworthy of re-election.

title: Defense Argues Kim Potter Fired What She Thought Was Stun Gun at Daunte Wright
summary: Prosecution says former officer in Minneapolis suburb failed in her basic duty. Kimberly Potter had to fire what she thought was her stun gun to save the life of her partner, her lawyer said in an opening statement Wednesday at the trial of the former police officer who shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop in a Minneapolis suburb in April.

title: Dropping the SAT Won't Solve the University of California's Problem
summary: A less rigorous admissions policy will admit more students who will struggle academically.. The University of California's effort to use admissions criteria that show no racial differences is a dead man walking. Performance gaps have persisted for centuries despite extensive educational efforts to ameliorate them and are revealed clearly with all tests that measure academic readiness.

title: Multiple Earthquakes Off Oregon Coast Pose No Threat of Tsunami
summary: 'Earthquake swarm' of more than 50 temblors occurred along Blanco Fracture Zone. Dozens of earthquakes rattled an active area off the coast of Oregon but posed no threat to residents in the Pacific Northwest state.

title: Starbucks Union Battle to Be Decided by Baristas in Labor-Friendly Buffalo, N.Y.
summary: Voting is set to close Wednesday in metro area with high concentrations of organized labor, including other cafe workers. Dozens of Starbucks Corp. workers in the Buffalo, N.Y., area are set to conclude voting Wednesday on whether to organize, potentially adding another union to a city that has been a longtime labor stronghold.

title: Workers Are Poised to Take Greater Slice of the Pie
summary: Balance of power is shifting from companies to workers, but it has a way to go yet. This might be labor's moment-the point when workers finally start grabbing a greater share of the economy, leaving employers and investors with a little less. But the Federal Reserve's willingness to let that happen hasn't yet been put to the test.

title: Deter Russia by Arming NATO Allies
summary: Moscow is challenging Europe's postwar security system, and not only by threatening Ukraine.. This week's virtual summit between President Biden and Vladimir Putin took place in an environment of diplomatic coercion, with Russian troops massing on the border with Ukraine. So far, the punitive actions at which the White House has hinted are insufficient to deter the Kremlin from further aggression. How did we arrive at a point where the U.S.-led security system, which has protected Europe for more than 70 years, appears to be tottering in the face of Russian saber-rattling?

title: Inflation Isn't 'Transitory' on My Farm
summary: My shipment of flowerpots is floating in the Pacific, and my fertilizer costs could triple this year.. Tarkio, Mo.

title: Outside San Francisco, a Mountaintop Home for Sale
summary: The San Jose property on 30 acres wants $3.68 million. It's not your typical Silicon Valley home. In San Jose, Calif., a property asking $3.68 million sits on roughly 30 acres atop a mountain ridge.

title: The Hills Are Alive
summary: This San Jose property asking $3.68 million sits on a mountaintop.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Deutsche Post DHL Names Tobias Meyer as CEO
summary: Company veteran will succeed Frank Appel as leader of the global logistics giant in 2023. Frank Appel will step down as chief executive of DHL parent Deutsche Post AG in 2023, the express and logistics giant said Wednesday, and will be succeeded by longtime company executive Tobias Meyer.

title: Beijing Reins In China's Central Bank
summary: Resume Subscription. The People's Bank of China has never been politically independent like a Western central bank, but it has nonetheless enjoyed a special status in the nation's economic hierarchy. Now, President Xi Jinping's shake-up of China's financial sector is stripping that away.

title: Why Washington Won't Fix Student Debt Plans That Overload Families
summary: Resume Subscription. U.S. lawmakers know the federal Plus student-loan programs have plunged millions of families into debt. They aren't eager to fix the problem.

summary: The world is set to generate an astronomical amount of digital information. To get a handle on it, start with a grain of rice.. Author

title: Omicron Variant Sends Some Office Holiday Parties Back to Zoom
summary: Workers and employers are split over whether to gather online or in person; 'The Zoom thing is for the birds.'. Work holiday parties-much like return-to-office plans-are all over the place this year.

title: How a Chicago Couple Updated an Experimental 1970s Home, and Left Room for Innovation
summary: Resume Subscription. Walter and Dawn Clark Netsch were one of 20th-century Chicago's great power couples. He was a partner and creative force at Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, the architecture firm that built several of the city's prominent skyscrapers. She was a Democratic politician, a law professor and the first woman to be nominated for governor of Illinois on a major party ticket. Together, they assembled an important collection of modern and contemporary art for their striking house, designed by Mr. Netsch in 1974, in the Near North Side's Old Town neighborhood.

title: India's Top Military Official Dies in Helicopter Crash
summary: Chief of defense staff and 12 others are killed in crash in Tamil Nadu, air force says. NEW DELHI-India's top military official, Bipin Rawat, died in a helicopter crash in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, the country's air force said, along with 12 others, including his wife.

title: McDonald's to Back Diverse Restaurant Owners
summary: Chain says it will put millions into loans to boost minority representation. McDonald's Corp. said Wednesday it would offer $250 million in low-interest loans to new franchisees over the next five years as a way to help increase diverse ownership of its U.S. restaurants.

title: Stressed? Worn Down? It's Time to Be Your Own Life Coach
summary: You can't always count on friends or family members for support. During tough times, you can learn to coach yourself.. Ever wish you had someone in your corner 24/7-cheering you on, picking you up when you're down, helping you set goals and deal with life's challenges?

title: Nestlé Finds a Cheap Way to Tiptoe Away From L'Oréal
summary: Swiss food company is reducing its stake in the French cosmetics firm and will hand most of the $10 billion proceeds to shareholders rather than the taxman. The respective owners of Purina pet food and Lancome cosmetics were always an odd couple, and have found an inexpensive way to start splitting up. A full separation between Nestlé and makeup giant L'Oréal would probably be costlier.

title: Private Jets, Luxury Hotels and Butlers-for Your Dog
summary: The travel industry is ramping up the amenities for guests' canine companions, offering everything from cushy dog beds and gluten-free meals to massages and facials. ELLIE SUFI adopted a dog in the early months of the pandemic. Ms. Sufi, 27, who had been living alone in a studio in downtown Chicago, said that Enzo, her French bulldog, got her through the loneliness of 2020. In September, she wanted to spoil him a bit so she booked a staycation for the two of them at the Ambassador Chicago, where a new package aims to pamper not only human guests but also furry, four-legged ones.

title: Top Colleges in the Northeast by Size
summary: The region has three of the nation's top five small, midsize and large colleges in the WSJ/THE College Rankings. The Northeast is home to three of the country's highest-ranked small colleges in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings, led by Amherst College. Three of the top five midsize schools in the U.S. also are in the Northeast, led by Harvard University, as well as three of the top large schools, with Cornell University atop that list.

title: Trafigura Scores $3 Billion Profit on Commodities Rebound
summary: Commodity trading house scored by loading up on oil when prices dropped early in pandemic. Trading house Trafigura Group Pte. Ltd. rode rising commodity prices to post record profit, making it a big winner from the pandemic economic rebound.

title: Japan's Seniors Discover New Way to Stay Young: Competitive Videogaming
summary: Average age on Matagi Snipers esports team is 68; 'better than having nothing to do at home'. AKITA, Japan-Sixty-six-year-old Atsuko Oyama shares a goal held by many people a half-century younger. She wants to get 100 kills in the first-person shooter videogame "Apex Legends."

title: Blood Samples Aid Tests of Covid-19 Vaccines Against Omicron
summary: Lab tests could determine whether modified booster shots need to be rolled out. Human blood samples and the substance that makes fireflies glow are among the tools that scientists are using for early clues about whether Covid-19 vaccines retain their effectiveness against the new Omicron virus variant.

title: GameStop, Pfizer, Stitch Fix, SentinelOne: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Stitch Fix shares plunged after its quarterly report; Earnings are due from GameStop. Wall Street indexes were mixed in early trading, while investors remained focused on the Omicron variant and its potential impact on the economy. Here's what we're watching in Wednesday's trading:

title: Martin Shkreli's Former Company Ordered to Pay $40 Million in Settlement Over Price-Gouging Case
summary: 'Pharma Bro' still faces antitrust trial for allegedly masterminding Daraprim price-hike operation. A drug company formerly run by Martin Shkreli was ordered to pay up to $40 million to settle allegations that it substantially raised prices of lifesaving medication, the Federal Trade Commission said.

title: Serena Williams Withdraws From Australian Open
summary: The 23-time major champion said she didn't feel physically ready to compete. Novak Djokovic, meanwhile, remains in the draw despite Melbourne's vaccine mandate. Next month's Australian Open will be the rare Grand Slam tennis tournament not to feature extended analysis of Serena Williams' physical fitness, seemingly a staple of major events for years now.

title: Hispanic Voters Now Evenly Split Between Parties, WSJ Poll Finds
summary: Republicans have made rapid gains among a crucial voting demographic that has long favored Democrats. The nation's large and diverse group of Hispanic voters is showing signs of dividing its support between Democrats and Republicans more evenly than in recent elections, a new Wall Street Journal poll finds, a troubling development for the Democratic Party, which has long counted on outsize Hispanic support.

title: The Facebook Files, a Podcast Series
Amazon Outage Disrupts Lives, Surprising People About Their Cloud Dependency
summary: When Amazon Web Services was interrupted, some vacuum cleaners, light switches and cat-food dispensers stopped working. Kyle Lerner and his girlfriend sensed something was amiss when they came home Tuesday and found their two Persian-Himalayan cats meowing nonstop.

title: Brazil's Nubank Set for One of 2021's Biggest IPOs
summary: The online bank, which plans to raise $2.6 billion, disrupted Brazil's big lenders and now has 48 million customers. When David Vélez tried to open an account in a Brazilian bank in 2012, it took him four months to win approval, not unusual in a country where high fees and bureaucracy are the norm in banking. When visiting the bank, he would leave his cellphone in a locker before passing through bulletproof doors as armed guards scrutinized him.

title: Dwyane Wade: Retirement Really "Opened Up My Mind to Life"
summary: The three-time NBA champion and five others on this month's Columnists topic: wisdom.. "When you're trying to accomplish something great, like when I set out to be the best athlete, the best basketball player that I could be, that's the only thing that you really have time to grow in. I was at a place where my ears were not open. I was a little stubborn, stuck in my ways, and it could be something as simple as what I ate. I wouldn't try anything new. I didn't like to go anywhere. I didn't like to travel. In the two years, going on three now, of retirement, I've opened up my mind to life, the real world. Once you open your eyes, you want to go learn. The people that come into your life, the people that you trust, they get you to try things, get you to listen differently, get you to travel to different places. Those people in my life have been probably the most important to my growth in wisdom."

title: The Parisian Catering Company to the Art and Architecture World
summary: In Rose Kitchen, Petra Lindbergh and Rose Chalalai Singh have built a high-profile following in the art and fashion worlds around their shared passion for the flavors of South and Southeast Asia. Tracing their thoughtful cuisine and elite client list.. As Rose Chalalai Singh tells it, a cèpe mushroom was the only thing standing between Rose Kitchen, the new catering venture she started with her friend Petra Lindbergh, and unqualified success during Paris's recent fall season, which coalesces around fashion week and the FIAC art fair. In one stretch, the two cooked 10 dinners on seven consecutive nights for a mix of the blue-chip galleries and fashion houses that have become Rose Kitchen's early customers. And somewhere in there, around day five, they put a raw mushroom carpaccio with shaved Parmesan on the menu. As Lindbergh was slicing cèpes in a client's kitchen, she forgot all about her severe allergy to Boletus edulis and popped a piece into her mouth to check its firmness, after which she began "turning so red," Singh says. "And I kept telling her, 'Petra, you have to go home. The client worries. And they don't want dead people in their house, because they have guests coming. They don't care if you're well or you're not well. They just want the thing to be done, you know?' "

title: Germany's Scholz Takes Power After Merkel's 16-Year Rule
summary: New chancellor is likely to adopt his predecessor's cautiously friendly posture toward the U.S.. BERLIN-Germany's parliament elected Olaf Scholz, 63, chancellor on Wednesday, ending Angela Merkel's 16-year rule. The country's new center-left leader inherits longstanding challenges from his predecessor and faces a cluster of short-term crises that could complicate his plans to modernize the German state and its economy.

title: U.S. Diplomatic Boycott of Beijing 2022 Puts American Athletes in a Bind
summary: U.S. athletes will awkwardly field questions about China-and satisfy nobody, no matter how they answer. Athletes heading to the most significant competition of their careers usually want to keep their heads down and their focus on their event. They train mentally as well as physically to block out any noise that isn't related to their sport.

title: Turkey's Woes Haven't Spread to Broader Emerging Markets
summary: Foreign investors and benchmark indexes reduced Turkish holdings in recent years. The world's biggest emerging markets have dodged contagion from Turkey's currency implosion, but there are other threats looming on the horizon.

title: Richard Branson-Backed SPAC Takes Grove Collaborative Public
summary: British billionaire will invest in the startup, a seller of sustainable consumer products, as part of the listing. A blank-check company backed by British billionaire Richard Branson's Virgin Group is merging with natural-consumer-products seller Grove Collaborative Inc. to take it public in a deal the companies value at $1.5 billion, the companies said Wednesday.

title: Not Vaccinated? In Singapore, You'll Pay for Your Own Covid-19 Treatment
summary: People who haven't received shots account for a disproportionate amount of the strain on healthcare resources, authorities say. SINGAPORE-As countries battle to persuade holdouts to get vaccinated, Singapore has settled on one of the most aggressive strategies: The city-state is going to stop fully covering Covid-19 medical bills for the unvaccinated.

title: T.J. Maxx and Off-Price Retail: Fashionably Late
summary: The apparel sector faces an uncertain 2022 after a year of explosive growth. Off-price sellers look poised to win.. Between factory shutdowns in Vietnam, supply-chain snags and a cotton-price surge, apparel sellers look stretched thin heading into 2022. Off-price retailers such as TJX Companies, Ross Stores and Burlington are poised to make a timely entrance, though.

title: Italy, Recovering Under Draghi, Debates Premiership
summary: Whether the former ECB chief continues to lead the government or becomes president could have repercussions for Italy's economy. ROME-Italy faces a dilemma at a critical moment for its economy and the fight against Covid-19: Should Mario Draghi remain prime minister for another year or become the country's largely ceremonial president for the next seven?

title: Stitch Fix Needs a 'Make It Work' Moment
summary: Online styling company's report signals significant transformation ahead. In the meantime, investors have lost interest.. Stitch Fix is about as polarizing to investors right now as low rise jeans are to consumers.

title: Lego to Build New Factory in Asia to Meet Rising Demand
summary: Making toys near where they're sold has helped Lego weather supply-chain disruptions during pandemic. Lego A/S plans to invest more than $1 billion in a new factory in Asia, seeking to serve growing demand for its toy bricks in the region and double down on a supply-chain strategy that held it in good stead through the pandemic.

title: Nestlé Sells $10 Billion of L'Oréal Shares Back to Beauty Giant
summary: Nescafé maker's move to pare stake in L'Oreal to 20% comes after cosmetics company's shares surged. Nestlé S.A. has agreed to reduce its stake in L'Oréal SA in a $10 billion deal that allows the world's biggest packaged-foods maker to capitalize on a rally in the French beauty giant's share price.

title: Covid-Era Travel Risks Are Changing: What to Consider So You Don't Get Stranded
summary: Sudden border closures. Quarantines. Given the new risks, the days of improvised trips for business or pleasure have become endangered in the Covid-19 era. At least you can see hurricanes coming.

title: Will LG Energy's IPO Overcharge?
summary: Spinning off LG Energy will help LG Chem unlock value and finance big capital expenditures. The world's second-largest electric-vehicle battery maker, LG Chem -owned LG Energy, is hoping a separate listing will give the business a little more spark.

title: Political and Business Leaders Share Views on Covid-19, Inflation, China, and Biden's Social and Climate Bill
summary: Tesla Founder Elon Musk, Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla and others across industries spoke at The Wall Street Journal's CEO Council Summit. The Omicron Covid-19 variant, President Biden's roughly $2 trillion social-policy and climate bill, inflation and competition with China were some of the issues that engaged business and political leaders this week at The Wall Street Journal's CEO Council Summit.

title: Chinese Social-Media Giant Weibo Drops in Hong Kong Market Debut
summary: Company secures homecoming listing amid uncertainty about the future of Chinese listings in the U.S.. Shares in Weibo Corp. began trading in Hong Kong on Wednesday, demonstrating the pull of the Asia financial hub as an alternative venue for Chinese companies whose stocks are already trading in the U.S.

title: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Loses Appeal of 1MDB Conviction
summary: Najib Razak will remain free on bail pending an appeal to country's highest court on charges related to his role in one of the world's largest financial scandals. KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia-Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak lost an appeal against his conviction last year on charges related to his role in one of the world's largest financial scandals, dealing a setback to the disgraced ex-leader amid a resurgence of his political clout.

title: Ma-a-a! (Wednesday Crossword, December 8)
Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Australia to Stage Diplomatic Boycott of 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing
summary: U.S. ally's decision comes after White House said it wouldn't send officials to the Games. ADELAIDE, Australia-Australia announced a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, joining the U.S. in forgoing official representation at the coming event in the latest show of strained tensions between Australia and China.

title: House Approves $778 Billion Defense Bill
summary: NDAA legislation includes military justice overhaul, Afghanistan commission, but lawmakers drop proposal to have women register for selective service. WASHINGTON-The House voted Tuesday to approve a $778 billion defense-policy and budget bill that authorizes $25 billion more in defense spending than requested by President Biden and contains a provision to create a commission on the War in Afghanistan, three months after America's longest war ended in a chaotic and bloody withdrawal.

title: House Votes to Approve Bill Setting Up Process for Lifting Debt Limit
summary: Proposed legislation would pave the way for Democrats to raise the limit in the Senate without Republican support. WASHINGTON-Top Republicans and Democrats struck a deal for a process to raise the debt ceiling in the Senate, with the House passing a bill late Tuesday that paves the way for Congress to prevent a calamitous default.

title: Investors Are Using Robinhood, Other Platforms to Jump Into Options Trades, Worrying U.S. Regulators
summary: Options contracts are swapping at highest level on record, with retail traders making a quarter of all activity. WASHINGTON-The flood of everyday Americans into options trading has drawn a skeptical eye from U.S. regulators, who are considering possible rule changes for the era of smartphone brokerage apps.

title: Saule Omarova Withdraws
summary: The White House lost on her nomination because it is bowing to Elizabeth Warren on financial regulation.. Saule Omarova on Tuesday withdrew her nomination to be Treasury's lead bank regulator, and the White House is portraying her as a victim. The real fault lies with the White House advisers who thought they could push through a nominee for Comptroller of the Currency who loathes the banking system she was going to supervise.

title: Mark Meadows Faces New Contempt Threat
summary: Trump's former chief of staff reverses course after saying he would appear for deposition regarding attack on Capitol. WASHINGTON-President Trump's final White House chief of staff, Mark Meadows, indicated to the House panel investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol that he would no longer cooperate with its probe, prompting the panel to renew its threat to recommend holding him in criminal contempt of Congress.

title: Saudi Arabia Pleads for Missile-Defense Resupply as Its Arsenal Runs Low
summary: Conflict pits $1 million Patriot interceptors against Houthi rebels' $10,000 'flying lawn mowers'. WASHINGTON-Saudi Arabia is running out of the ammunition it uses to defend against weekly drone and missile attacks on its kingdom and is urgently appealing to the U.S. and its Gulf and European allies for a resupply, U.S. and Saudi officials said.

title: Tackling Profits From Environmental Crimes Could Help the Climate, FATF President Says
summary: The head of the Financial Action Task Force says the issue is often overlooked as nations give priority to other crimes. Governments need to recognize and take action against money laundering linked to environmental crimes, which can have the added benefit of helping to mitigate climate change, the head of an international anti-money-laundering watchdog said.

title: Wynn Names Gambling-Industry Executive as CFO
summary: Julie Cameron-Doe is set to succeed Craig Billings as the Las Vegas-based casino operator's finance chief next year. Wynn Resorts Ltd. appointed a gambling-industry veteran to oversee the casino operator's finances just weeks after the company announced it would elevate its finance chief to the role of chief executive.

title: Breaking Down Treasury's Proposed Corporate-Ownership Rules
summary: The U.S. proposes new rules for a forthcoming corporate ownership database, which authorities hope will combat the illicit use of shell companies. Here are the top takeaways.. Rules proposed by the U.S. Treasury Department on a forthcoming corporate ownership database offer new details regarding which companies will be required to submit information, and about whom.

title: Commission Approves Report on Supreme Court Amid Partisan Differences
summary: Experts praise process of exploring debates over high court's makeup and role without resolving them. WASHINGTON-A bipartisan commission appointed by President Biden unanimously adopted a report detailing controversies over the Supreme Court and assessing proposals to address them, but few expected the 294-page document to resolve political divisions concerning the judiciary that have intensified in recent years.
